bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 129 (Tuesday, July 30, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. BASS:H.R. 4101.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This resolution is enacted pursuant to the power granted inCongress under Article I, Section 1.[Page H7481]

item.name: Urban and suburban affairs and development

item.text:
Build Local, Hire Local Act

This bill requires certain employment practices for specified federally assisted infrastructure projects and creates several infrastructure related grant programs.

Among other things, this bill requires these projects to

  • hire a certain percentage of local workers, with priority given to individuals with a barrier to employment, veterans, and individuals from populations that are traditionally underrepresented in the infrastructure workforce;
  • expend a certain percentage of funds received through a small business concern and subcontract a certain percentage of projects through a small business concern; and
  • expend a certain percentage of funds received through businesses owned and controlled by socially or economically disadvantaged individuals, women, veterans, LGBTQ individuals, disabled individuals, or ex-offenders.

Further, all laborers, mechanics, and service employees employed by contractors or subcontractors on these projects must be paid wages at rates equal to those prevailing on projects of a similar character in the locality. Recipients of funds for these projects must also develop and maintain workforce diversity programs to ensure equal employment opportunities.

In addition, the Department of Transportation, in coordination with other specified federal agencies, must establish a grant program to provide grants to eligible entities for various infrastructure related projects to create connected, economically prosperous, and environmentally and physically healthy communities. Similarly, the Department of Labor, in consultation with other specified federal agencies, must establish a grant program to provide grants to eligible entities to carry out job training programs to ensure a pipeline of qualified workers in targeted infrastructure industries.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Build Local, Hire Local Act

item.title: To establish an expansive infrastructure program to create local jobs and raise the quality of life in every community, to launch middle class career pathways in infrastructure, and to invest in high-quality American jobs, and for other purposes.

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
